title: Interaction-Based Learning Design in Online Educational Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Basic knowledge of online learning platform usage and digital literacy
context.additional_context: Learners engage in weekly face-to-face classes combined with online activities, with discussion boards and video content as primary learning resources. Interactions among instructors, learners, and peers are emphasized as core elements of learning outcomes

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish and explain the three dimensions of the Community of Inquiry (CoI) framework: teaching, cognitive, and social presence.
Learners can participate in and perform collaborative problem-solving activities with peers via online discussion boards at over 80% engagement.
Learners can predict learning outcomes by analyzing the correlation between video content viewership and discussion participation rates.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
